title: Historical Stock Splits and Corporate Actions of Dupont De Nemours Inc

content.text: 1. April 9, 1999: DuPont announces a 2-for-1 stock split, increasing the number of outstanding shares.
2. March 31, 2015: DuPont spins off its Chemours subsidiary to shareholders, distributing one Chemours share for every five DuPont shares held.
3. August 31, 2017: Dow Chemical and DuPont complete their merger, forming DowDuPont Inc. The merger involves an exchange ratio of 1 share of DowDuPont for every 1 share of DuPont.

4. June 1, 2019: DowDuPont completes the separation of its materials science division as Dow Inc. and is renamed DuPont de Nemours Inc. Shareholders of DowDuPont receive one share of DuPont de Nemours for every three shares of DowDuPont.
5. September 1, 2021: DuPont de Nemours completes a 1-for-3 reverse stock split, reducing the number of outstanding shares and increasing the share price.

news.headline: Carlsberg Wins Global Industrial Water Reuse Award Using DuPont Technology

news.headline: DuPont Leaders to Discuss Sustainability and Innovation in Semiconductor Materials at Strategic Materials Conference
news.summary: DuPont (NYSE: DD) today announced that Randal (Randy) King, PhD, Vice President of R&D, DuPont Electronics & Industrial, and Scott Collick, Vice President, Sustainability, will deliver presentations on sustainability and innovation in the semiconductor industry at the SEMI Strategic Materials Conference in San Jose, California, Oct. 2-4, 2023.
